intro: Pimpinella quercetorum, commonly known as the oak-leaf cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that resemble the shape of oak leaves, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Pimpinella quercetorum is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in traditional herbal remedies.
